chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called:  1:54 pm
Includes cases 16CF198 and 16CF16.
State appears by ADA Matthew Adrian; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman.
Time set for FPT.
Atty Adrian states history, Atty Bachman makes statements.
OTR:  1:58 pm; BOTR:  2:18 pm
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to:
16CF16:
Ct 1 (Intentionally Contact-Order for Felony Conviction-Repeater)>>DRI
16CF198:
Ct 4 (DC-DA Repeater-DA-Repeater)>>DRI
COURT GRANTS
PLEA:
16CF198:
Ct 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>GUILTY
Ct 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>GUILTY
Ct 3 (Intentionally Contact Vic)>>GUILTY
Ct 5 (Resisting-Repeater)>>GUILTY
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty; Deft makes statements.
COURT ORDERS:
16CF198
Cts 1, 2, 3:
7 years Wisconsin State Prison (4 years IC/3 years ES), concurrent to each other and to all counts in 15CF871;
Ct 5:
2 years Wisconsin State Prison (1 year IC/1year ES), concurrent to each other and to all counts in 15CF871;
All to run concurrent.  Credit for 248 days on each count.  Deft is eligible for CIP and SAP.
CONDITIONS:  Any counseling, treatment agent deems appropriate, including domestic abuse treatment, No contact with vic unless approved by the department, CC, DNA sample + surcharge.

Clerk:

Case called: 9:02am
INCLUDES 15CF871, 16CF16, 16CF198
State of WI appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse.
Date and time set for argued SAR in 15CF871 & bond modification in 16CF16 & 16CF198

State says there will be argued sentencing after revocation in 15CF871 & bond modification of lifting no contact with victim in 16CF16 & 16CF198
Victim- W.K. a/k/a K.K. makes statement to lift no contact with her 

SAR 15CF871:
State makes argument on sentencing recommendation 
Atty Toulouse makes argument on sentencing recommendation
Defandant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 2- (False Imprisonment- domestic abuse): 6 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 3 years ES. Ct. 5- (Battery- domestic abuse): 9 months MCJ. Ct. 6- (Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse): 90 days MCJ. Sentencing to run concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS:  No contact with W.K. a/k/a K.K. Complete SAFE intake or battery treatment programming. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Subject to random UA's to ensure for sobriety compliance. Pay any outstanding court costs. 199 days credit granted. Defendant is NOT eligible for either prison programming based on nature of offense. 

Deft is remanded to Marathon County Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Prison. 

Bond modification in 16CF16 & 16CF198:
Atty Toulouse makes argument to lift non-waivable no contact with victim
COURT DENIES Atty Toulouse's request to lift no contact
COURT ORDERS: non-waivable no contact with victim- W.K. a/k/a K.K. continues

COURT instructs both parties to set future dates with Br. 1 JA

Adj: 9:41am
Defense Notice and Motion for Modification of Bond - stj

Jury Trial on August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
